answers.answer: Hi! Thanks for asking. My head hurt so bad, so I called and asked a nurse if I should be concerned. She said to just come in and get my BP checked. I did and it was 147/99!! I have NO idea why it was that high. I was in L&D for about 3 hrs and it gradually went down to about 120/80. My headache didn't go away though. Swelling was minimal and urine was negative for protein. While I was there though, I was having LOTS of contractions. So much that they thought it was necessary to check me. I am only a fingertip dilated and a little effaced. They sent me home with Tylenol #3 (codeine). I took that and then went to bed. Headache seems to be gone today. I don't get why I had such high BP and then it went down, but I guess I should just be glad that so far I don't have preeclampsia.How is everyone else today?
I'm so glad you went in.  I'll keep you in my thoughts and hopefully your bp stays down and the headache stays away.

oh boy...i'm sorry you had such a yucky day. i feel your pain though. the blood pressure could have caused the headache or vice versa. i have early preeclampsia and seem to walk around with a headache daily. caused by my blood pressure. blehdid they say you should watch your sodium intake?i hope this was a one time thing for you and stays away.

Geesh, I missed your other post.   I'm glad you went to go get checked.  Your b/p sounds like mine!  I'm glad you and Brody are ok.  Not too much longer now.  hang in there.   If you need anything you know where to find us!!

Thank you. I am at my wits end with all of these issues lately. It's good to know that I can come here and ask questions. You guys are awesome (:Chelly, have they given you anything for your headaches and/or high BP? I can't even imagine having more than one baby sapping me of energy and everything else!

Hi, ladies.  Don't want to take up posts for small questions so I'll ask it here.  I'm a little confused about my lmp.  AF was due June 20th.  On June 18th I was having bloody discharge (sorry TMI) and it continued until June 20 when I finally got AF.  Do I consider June 18 as the first day of AF or the 20th?  Thanks.
Glad to hear that things were taken care of hun.  When are you due again?  Could it have been that you were nervous/upset/worried that your BP went up like that?  Were they concerned about it?

How are u!! Hate to jump in on your post, but I haven't talked to you in a whild.  Ryan is now 3 weeks old and he sleep pretty good last night for the first time.  But it is different every night.  Poor thing had bad gas last night.  He seems to have trouble with gas.  I feel for him.  He likes to be held too :-)  Things with my ex are going ok.  He had a change of heart once he saw the baby.  I remember when I was having my C-section he held my hand.  I was shocked because he hadn't touched me in six months.  He is tring to get me to move in with him again but he doesn't tell me he loves me or sorry for what he has done.  I think he is tring to avoid child support.  Why move in with someone who doesn't tell me he loves me.

I'm happy to hear Ryan slept last night.  With our 1st she slept thru the night from the very beginning. With our second he was up 4-5 times a night.  We kept thinking WTF???? But we made it thru and now he's 7. Still wakes up during the night and wants to cuddle.Hopefully the ex continues to be in Ryan's life.  I think kids need both parents as long as one of them isn't abusive.  Did he tell his kids and family about Ryan?  I think you are doing the right thing with not moving back in with him.You deserve so much better than that.  Stay strong for yourself and Ryan.

I'm not sure why it was up. I didn't feel nervous, upset or stressed. My headache just came on and got so severe I wasn't sure if I could keep my eyes open to drive. They told me pain can bring up your blood pressure, so that could have been it. Once I got there the room was dark and I relaxed in the bed. It might have been just enough to bring it down. I have a digital BP monitor now though, thanks to a good friend of mine who is a nurse. I will be using that whenever I think it's high.

My daughter drank 3 oz as soon as she was born.  By 3 wks she was eating 6 ounces at a time.  She ate every 3-4 hrs but slept all night (10pm to 6am).My son didn't eat as much at each feeding.  He would if we let him but he had projectile vomiting so we fed him smaller amounts more often.

Yes, the kids know and they came to the hospital.  His daughter loves the baby and always asked to see him.  His son likes him too, but won't hold him.  I think he is scared.  You know, no one can hate a baby.  So I think once they saw him, they loved him - same with Craig.  He gave me $300 the other day too and has agreed to pay for the birth - all of it.  He said - we will see how long the change stays.  His parents know and loves the baby too.  His mother is very sick and doesn't have long to live, so I went with him to see her because I'm not sure when she is going to go.  His dad wants to see him again too, so I have agreed to go with him there this weekend.Did any of you children eat a lot.  Ryan took in almost 5oz about an hour ago. I thought this was to much, but he cried and sucked on his fingers so I knew he was hungry.  I thought only 2-3oz.  He is fussy too!!

question: Did the Dr call you back?   How are you today?
title: Jenshim/ open forum
